clueServer
Class ServerListener

java.lang.Object
  clueServer.ServerListener

public class ServerListener
extends Object

Class semantics and roles:
Class that describes a server listener. handle initial connection requests from the clients

Information maintenance:
Creation: The single ServerListener object created at start up
Deletion: the ServerListener object is destroyed when the server-side software is terminated.

Author:
Erich Schudt (Class Skeletons), Michael Philippone (Code)

Field Summary
private  int port
          the port number
private  ServerSocket serverSock
          stores an instance of the listening socket
private  Users users
          A Back reference to the Users class for Player creation and addition
 
Constructor Summary
ServerListener(Users u)
          Constructor that creates a serverListener
Purpose: default constructor
Takes 1 arguments, applies the default port static property from the Utilities class
ServerListener(Users u, int portIn)
          Purpose: Constructor that creates a serverListener
What it does:

First: assign the given port to the internal port representation
Second: create a new Server listening socket on the specified port
Third: start listening for player connections
 
Method Summary
 boolean listenForUsers()
          Purpose: receive and handle a connection

Precondition: port has a value
Postcondition: connection is established from client
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> WHILE the number of connected Player's is less than the number of required players: -> -> listen for a connection attempt and create a socket when one is detected
-> -> read the first line of communication from the subsequent socket (This is the username)
-> -> create a new Player with the socket and the new information END
NOTE: this method assumes that the first line read from a socket is the username for that player
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

Method Detail

listenForUsers

public boolean listenForUsers()
Purpose: receive and handle a connection

Precondition: port has a value
Postcondition: connection is established from client
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
-> WHILE the number of connected Player's is less than the number of required players: -> -> listen for a connection attempt and create a socket when one is detected
-> -> read the first line of communication from the subsequent socket (This is the username)
-> -> create a new Player with the socket and the new information END
NOTE: this method assumes that the first line read from a socket is the username for that player

Returns:
boolean true if it is successful, false if it fails at some point
